Description: Lid sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl; white slip; interior reserved; exterior: from top, dilute band; black-figure decoration consisting of front part of lion (head, part of chest and front paw preserved; with added red on mane) to right; at right, haunch of seated lion to right; three incised rosettes with red centres as filling ornament; below, row of black dots between pairs of dilute lines.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in Group A of the Sphinx and Lion Style. The decoration on the vases from this group is the most elaborate. The rosette has a standard cogwheel shape and the figures are carefully drawn and details are expertly incised.
Bibliographic references: Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. XII, no. 4)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 147, p. 314, no. 1336)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2069) (phase 2)
